publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2981 Ms Margo MacDonald: Scottish Swimming Achievements-That the Parliament congratulates Alison Sheppard on her new Commonwealth record time of 24.96 seconds for the 50 metres freestyle and records its appreciation of the role she has played in inspiring swimmers like Kirsty Balfour and Gregor Tait from the City of Edinburgh Club to win British championships, thus enhancing the current improvement in the standard of Scottish swimming.
S1M-2981 Scottish Swimming Achievements (lodged on 15 April 2002) Michael Matheson*
S1M-2981 Scottish Swimming Achievements (lodged on 15 April 2002) Ms Sandra White*
S1M-2981 Scottish Swimming Achievements (lodged on 15 April 2002) Mr Keith Harding*, Cathie Craigie*, Iain Smith*, Michael Russell*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Christine Grahame*

S1M-2981 Ms Margo MacDonald: Scottish Swimming Achievements-That the Parliament congratulates Alison Sheppard on her new Commonwealth record time of 24.96 seconds for the 50 metres freestyle and records its appreciation of the role she has played in inspiring swimmers like Kirsty Balfour and Gregor Tait from the City of Edinburgh Club to win British championships, thus enhancing the current improvement in the standard of Scottish swimming. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Ms Sandra White, Mr Keith Harding, Iain Smith, Michael Russell, Dorothy-Grace Elder, Christine Grahame, Nora Radcliffe, Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-2981 Scottish Swimming Achievements (lodged on 15 April 2002) Dennis Canavan*
S1M-2981 Scottish Swimming Achievements (lodged on 15 April 2002) Kay Ullrich*
S1M-2981 Scottish Swimming Achievements (lodged on 15 April 2002) Fergus Ewing*, Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-2981 Scottish Swimming Achievements (lodged on 15 April 2002) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*
S1M-2981 Scottish Swimming Achievements (lodged on 15 April 2002) Donald Gorrie*
